hackathons.summary: I actively engage in hackathons in the fields of AI/ML for bio-image analysis, drug discovery, and computational biomedicine. This engagement helps me stay connected with the latest in the field, constantly working on new and challenging problems, and networking with like-minded individuals. With a strong background in electronics and communications engineering, I bring a unique perspective to computational biology, constantly seeking innovative solutions to complex problems.

hackathons.name: BioHackathon Germany 2023
hackathons.summary: Contributed to SpaceHack, a community benchmarking effort in spatially resolved transcriptomics. Explored spatial transcriptomics tools and evaluated their performance on diverse tissue datasets.

hackathons.name: Cytodata 2023 Hackathon
hackathons.summary: Worked on renal cancer multiplexed imaging data (80GB). Developed cancer aggressiveness prediction models and explored marker relevance by tumor location. Won the hackathon with a team of 4.

hackathons.name: Her Hackathon 2023
hackathons.summary: Developed 'Linda', an AI wellness specialist for skin comfort during menstrual cycles, using Skinly dataset and hormonal change studies. Built in a team of 5.

hackathons.name: Image Analysis Hackathon 2022
hackathons.summary: Worked on automated artefact removal using GANs and inpainting for colorectal cancer images. Received Honorable Mention. Supervised by Dr. Clarence Yapp.

hackathons.name: Her Hackathon 2022
hackathons.summary: Built 'Tree of Life', a web app linking patients to clinical trials and encouraging diversity via a diversity index and network-based HCP mapping.

hackathons.name: Juelich Data Challenges Hackathon 2021
hackathons.summary: Used graph-based ML to predict gender from fMRI connectivity across 436 brain parcels using resting-state data. Supervised by Dr. Susanne Weis.

projects.name: COVIM/ImmunoHub
projects.summary: Led the COVIM Common Metadata Model and ImmunoHub platform for metadata integration across COVID-19 immunology studies in Germany.
highlights: Built LaminDB-based ImmunoHub metadata repository.
Aligned with biomedical standards (EFO, OMOP, GHGA).
Implemented ingestion pipelines using ICD-10 and ATC vocabularies.
Led schema governance using Git and lnschema-covim.
Ensured FAIR compliance and secure site-specific deployments.

projects.name: CMI-PB Multimodal ML
projects.summary: Designed and led a multimodal ML pipeline to predict vaccine priming using cross-cohort immune data fusion from CMI-PB challenge datasets.
highlights: SHAP-based fusion of gene expression, antibody, cytokine, and cell data.
Cross-cohort generalization with multiple classifiers (RF, SVM, XGBoost, etc.).
Key features: IgG4 (FHA/PT), cytokines (CCL8, IL-1α, CXCL9).
Invited talk at La Jolla Institute, ECCB 2025 paper accepted.
Manuscript in preparation consolidating findings and proposing validation.

projects.name: PANTA-COVIM WP6 T Cell Classification
projects.summary: Led development of ML models for SARS-CoV-2 antigen-reactive T cell detection across sites using flow cytometry data.
highlights: XGBoost cell-level classifier with donor-level score aggregation.
Cross-site robustness, preprocessing of non-T cells, cluster annotation cleanup.
Benchmarked predictions against manual gating.
Developed prototype neural pooling model for donor classification.

projects.name: PhD Research – Protein-Protein Interaction Hotspots
projects.summary: Developed ML pipelines for hotspot residue prediction using RPCA and XGBoost, applied to structure and sequence-based PPI features.
highlights: RPCA for noise reduction and dimensionality reduction.
Applied to independent test sets for generalization.
Presented at AdvCompBio 2019 (oral) and Summer School Leuven 2018 (poster).
Attended deep learning and bioinformatics workshops (BSC, LRZ, CNC, DeepLearn).
